alert.note: Alert for Banner; Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 5:14PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Kimball, southwestern Banner and east central Laramie Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 414 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Oliver Campground, or 10 miles west of Kimball, moving northwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kimball, Albin, Oliver Campground, Oliver Reservoir and Bushnell. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 6 and 15. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for the Panhandle of Nebraska...and southeastern Wyoming.
